article_title: How did I improve the automatic line wrapping and icons of this card? What are the steps to implement these in Pyside6? Will long text overflow the screen? These are all good questions that this article will describe in detail
article_content:
In PySide6 development, text auto-wrapping and icon management are two common UI optimization issues. This article will explain the implementation steps in detail from the following aspects: First, we need to use QLabel's setWordWrap and setMaximumWidth properties to implement basic text wrapping functionality. Second, through the custom format_text_with_breaks method, we can force line breaks after a specified number of characters to avoid single lines of text being too long and causing visual disharmony. For icons, I used the FontManager class to uniformly manage Material Icons font icons
When handling long text display, I implemented expand/collapse functionality, displaying two lines of text by default with ellipsis at the end, allowing users to click to view the full content. This improves the software's appearance rather than showing a large block of text. For text width control, I ensure text doesn't exceed card boundaries using setMaximumWidth and elideText methods.
Finally, we also optimized the card's visual effects by adding shadows, rounded corners, and hover states

intro_text:
ClutUI Next Generation is a new generation UI development framework not based on ClutUI1.0
Dedicated to providing a simple, efficient, and beautiful interface development experience
tech_info:
Based on Python 3.12 & PySide6
UI design references Material Design 3
Fonts: HarmonyOS Sans & Mulish
Icons: Material Icons
Animations: QPropertyAnimation & QEasingCurve
